author: Doug Bostrom
content: And still to this day (at least in the more flea-sized recreational maritime world), powerboats seem hell bent on crossing ahead, leading to a steady diet of stand on until the last minute, grumble and give way.

author: Craig Northacker
content: I had the good fortune to crew on the Schooner Pioneer with the South Street Seaport Museum, which also owned the Peking at the time. My wife and I were married on the poop deck of the Peking in August – and our band played ska, reggae, and a lot of other great music. Having been fortunate to sail on other tall ships, I can think of nothing more majestic than spending time on a ship that helped make history. Thanks for sharing!
